column5: Great pictures.  Thanks for sharing,  MTBF
stand up and take a bow!.....Excellent report and nice shootin!
Wow - excellent report.   The real estate agent was right -location, location, locaton. All of those lakes are within a couple hours? Envy......
awesome report bud !! some very nice fish you caught this summer,is that an aurura trout ??   those colors look amazing !! thanks for sharing..cheers
Thanks for the reply Mike.   Cheers, Ron...
Fantastic report man, that Aurora is a beauty!!!!
Your new avatar and motto:  I don't post often.....but when I do....it's EPIC    Amazing summer man....great photography and fantastic fishing....thank you so much for sharing.
Mike, you seemed to have done more in one summer than most of us dream about doing in a lifetime. My hat goes off to you!

Every summer I think is gonna be less busy than the last.......... and every summer I'm wrong. A day off a week has been welcome, at one point it was 4 weeks straight without a day off between work and other jobs.  I did sneak away for a fish any chance I got though, even if it was just for an evening walleye or brown trout fish and I seemed to have done all right.  Here's a bunch o pics of my summer.   The family of Cooper's Hawks returned this spring.     First trout in the new square back.         A quick trip got me into a new P.Best inland brown.       A couple of evening trips for eyes.           Campfire Sweet Chilli Thai wings. Mmmmmmmm.       Overnight trip for bows.         Had a weekend to explore and got into to a back lake full of these laker imitators. Caught 7 and missed another 5 by noon before the storms rolled in.         While talking with this fella over a chipmunk dinner he mentioned an elusive trout.       ROAD TRIP!!!!!!!!!!             Looks like the fall is here along with a weeks worth of well needed vacation.  Fall Spec   Fall splake    Hope you enjoyed.
Some amazing pics there! Thanks for sharing
Fantastic bunch of pictures there,  specially  the ones of the birds !!
Fantastic pictures and fish.... is that an Aurora??
Awesome report. The scenery/fish pics are amazing. What a great mix bag of species, especially the 5 trout species! Can u please clarify on the chipmunk dinner? Haha.
Very nice pics! Thanks for posting.
looks like a fantastic summer to me  thanks for sharing
Great pics
amazing pictures and amazing fish!!!  Loved the ones of hawks and the road trip one!!!!
awesome report and great pics!
Yes the golden Aurora Trout, largest one I have caught yet.

6 trout species.  At first I thought it had hurt its wings, then I realized he was crushing his meal for a couple mins before he dug in. Couldnt tell what he was snacking on till I got too close and he flew away holding the chipmunk.  Oh well one less tree rat
6 trout! I need to relearn how to count.  Ok, I got the impression it was you guys eating the chipmunks... I have only tried squirrel. Haha
Yes, I think I can speak for everyone on this post...  WE ALL ENJOYED!  Seems like you found yourself a little piece of Heaven. All these species found relatively close to you?  Cheers, Ron...
amazing report  what beautiful fish/scenery. I have never targeted or for that matter, caught a trout before. They sure are gorgeous creatures
Looks like you really love your trout fishing. Congrats on an amazing season. We appreciate your report and pictures. Thanks for sharing.
Wow, gorgeous fish.
That is some beautiful country your fishing! Your a lucky man to have those fishing spots at your disposal   Congrats on a great summer. I look forward to your fall fishing post.  Thanks,  Clarence
Those were great, you live a wonderful life. Thanks for showing us.

Much nicer seeing some of those pics off the camera screen and blown up big here.  NEVER can I remember, ANYONE posting about 6 trout species all caught within a summer.  That aurora takes the cake Mike just because, but man... that brown, that splake...  You never fail to impress each year with your Grandslam 5 trout reports... but this year with 6 ya hit it out of the park then rounded two more bases for a double.  WarCanoe... lakers... hopefully soon.
great photos - thanks for sharing
Wow, you're great with a camera, some amazing shots there.  Beautiful fish you caught!!!  Looks like it was a great summer for you.

Glad everyone enjoyed these as much as I did.  Ron all of those trout species are within a few hours of home except for the Aurora trout.  Bunk a trip in the war canoe would be ultra cool. Just pick a Sunday or Monday  Even with these 25-30km winds, rain and a wicked cold keeping me away from the lakes for the last half of my vacation I managed 2 solid days of fantastic fall spec fishn.
Excellent report, fish and pics Selfmade05 Great recap of your 2011 summer.... congrats Thanks for taking the time to post and share with us!!! Leechman
great pics....
